CHAT.comment: First home visit; took place in living room; CHI sat on floor and Mot joined her and sat alternately at her side and across from her
throughout the toy play people standing outside the living room window can be heard talking , yelling , etc.; music can also be heard at times

u.a: during the early part of the toy play BRO can be heard calling for his mother from his bedroom
bef Mot pulls part of the tea set from the bag
CHI and Mot continue to look at the toys they pull from the bag
aft Mot places puzzle frame on the floor and she and CHI look for pieces
aft offers a puzzle piece to CHI
clucks tongue in dismay and sighs .
enters BRO's room and brings him out
CHI continues to play with the puzzle
MOT looks at puzzle box and sees that it is recommended for children ages 3-8
MOT and CHI put different puzzle pieces in different places
MOT and CHI continue trying to complete the puzzle
BRO may be referring to a phone
toy play breaks here and another elicited report is attempted
MOT and CHI concentrate on the puzzle
starts unpacking Chutes and Ladders , with her back to other people in the room
EXP is referring to Chutes and Ladders
MOT has reentered room with tissue; she leaves again
puts Chutes and Ladders back in its box
aft Mot sets pad of paper on floor in front of CHI , between CHI and herself
writes a line of T's on another sheet
CHI rips the sheet from the pad and hands it to EXP
moves to area of floor where blocks and tea toys are and begins to rummage
BRO begins scribbling on pad and handing sheets to EXP
CHI gets some animals from sofa and EXP hands her the remaining ones
MOT and CHI arrange cups and saucers
CHI may be referring to a cup or saucer
CHI smiles and drinks and holds cups to the animals' mouths
pretends to prepare and serve cold drinks
CHI and BRO begin pulling at a phone
CHI stands facing Mot , holding phone to ear , smiling
